name: Otoscope
specification: Handheld device with built-in LED light source; lightweight plastic or metal casing; interchangeable specula (3â€“8 mm diameter); 3X magnification lens; some models include an insufflation port for pneumatic testing.
function: Used to visually examine the ear canal and tympanic membrane (eardrum) for diagnosis of ear conditions.
usage: Attach a clean speculum appropriate to patient size; gently insert the speculum into the ear canal without forcing; illuminate and observe ear structures through the magnifier; conduct pneumatic testing if equipped.
maintenance: Disinfect the otoscope and reusable specula after each use; replace bulbs and specula as needed; store in a dry, clean environment; perform regular functional checks..
warning: Inserting the speculum too deeply or forcefully may cause injury or discomfort; ensure proper size and gentle handling to avoid trauma..
